meanings.definition: A person who works only for pay.
meanings.sent1: The hireling completed the job for a salary.
meanings.sent2: The company hired a new hireling to help with the project.
meanings.sent3: The hireling happily accepted the payment for their work.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the villain hired a hireling to do his dirty work.
meanings.sent5: The hireling's sole motivation was the paycheck at the end of the week.

meanings.definition: Serving for pay or financial gain.
meanings.sent1: The hireling attitude of the temporary worker was evident.
meanings.sent2: The hireling services were efficient but lacked dedication.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant's hireling chef cooked with precision and skill.
meanings.sent4: The hireling nature of the transaction left no room for loyalty.
meanings.sent5: The hireling mentality prioritized money over passion in the job.
